news.title: UK will not tolerate Chinese spying, minister says after MI5 alert to MPs and peers
news.summary: Politicians have been warned they are being targeted by suspected Chinese spies posing as "headhunters".

news.title: Net migration 20% lower than first thought as more British nationals left UK
news.summary: The figures also reveal migration peaked 38,000 higher than previously reported in the year to March 2023.

news.title: Palestine Action activist hit officer with hammer during defence firm break-in, jury told
news.summary: Six Elbit Systems protesters caused "serious damage" to the Israel-based defence firm's UK site.

news.title: Travel warning as snow and ice move in across country
news.summary: A number of snow and ice warning are coming into effect as a deep cold front moves over Scotland.

news.title: Delays to my rapist's trial left me terrified, survivor tells BBC
news.summary: Morwenna Loughman says delays deepened her trauma, as new research finds a third of trials were postponed last year.

news.title: Catherine's first speech in two years calls for dignity for carers
news.summary: The Princess of Wales tells business leaders about the importance of supporting families with young children.

news.title: Google boss says trillion-dollar AI investment boom has 'elements of irrationality'
news.summary: In an exclusive BBC interview, Sundar Pichai hailed artificial intelligence as an "extraordinary moment" but said no company would be immune if bubble burst.

news.title: Man who cryogenically froze late wife sparks debate by dating new partner
news.summary: Gui Junmin froze his dead spouse as a sign of his devotion - but it's now emerged he is dating again.

news.title: How much will fans save under proposed new ticketing rules?
news.summary: A proposed law will make it illegal to resell tickets for events such as concerts above face value.

news.title: What now for Queen's playhouse after Andrew evicted from Royal Lodge?
news.summary: Y Bwthyn Bach is a beloved Wendy house gifted by the people of Wales to Princess Elizabeth in 1932.
